Hi thethingy,

why it's very obvious that you have some outstanding torrents here, why can you not make them more simple to use like say the torrents of Gordsmash for example?? All this talk of pasting lines into host's and running clean installs with toolkits  if it fails the first time and infects all the other Adobe products. With Gordsmash you simply install as trial, run an activation blocker(which is a one click process no copying and pasting) then replace the DLL files and Voila!!! away you go with no problems.
Again  I know your torrents are good in that they work but couldnt you simplify them a tad.
Just a suggestion.

WhiteA9, it is really a straight forward process. the "blocker" you talk of adds entries to the hosts file but with the updates applied the "blocker" is inefective so you have to add additional lines to the hosts manually and in all fairness its a simple task that you could train a monkey to do. If you install as a trial then when you update the activation service closes the app so you need to have a full copy installed first. All my adobe torrents are the latest versions and all of them update so the few extra steps you have to do are well worth the minimal effort

Thethingy; this is a great download. Just to everyone who is STILL confused about this error 130:3, for VISTA 32 BIT, the second you turn on the internet and try to use the app, Adobe will give you 130: 3 message. This is only natural afterall. There should e nothing wrong with your host to begin with but check anyways. Before you use the LicenseRecover.exe, make sure you open up Task Manager to  see if any Adobe related processes or apllications are open. End them if you find any. The license recovery shouldnt work by itself though; do the License Method 1 stuff. That shouldn't work by itself either. Do the .dll replacments in C:\Program Files\Adobe\Photoshop Elements 8.0 and C:\Program Files\Adobe\Elements Organizer 8.0, as those are the only folders affiliated with Elements 8 and  which have a amtlib.dll file. That's all that is needed to do to make this great torrent run like a dream. AGAIN THANKS THETHINGY. Note that this final solution has only been proven effective on the Vista 32-bit OS.

I have a question about this article on CNET about an issue with security, and is this an issue with this software too...if so, do you have a patch...

Here's the article:

Adobe has issued a security advisory about a "critical" vulnerability in its Flash Player and Adobe Reader and Acrobat products that it says could let attackers take control of people's computers.

The company said late Friday that there had been reports of the hole actually being exploited and that an official patch was not yet available.

Affected software includes:

    * Adobe Flash Player 10.0.45.2, 9.0.262, and earlier 10.0.x and 9.0.x versions for Windows, Macintosh, Linux, and Solaris
    * Adobe Reader and Acrobat 9.3.2 and earlier 9.x versions for Windows, Macintosh, and UNIX

The company said the Flash Player 10.1 Release Candidate does not seem to be vulnerable and that Adobe Reader and Acrobat 8.x are confirmed not vulnerable.

Adobe didn't say when an official fix would be released, but according to the company, computer users can mitigate the Flash issue by downloading the release candidate mentioned above. The Acrobat and Reader issue can be addressed by "deleting, renaming, or removing access to the authplay.dll file" that ships with those products, Adobe said. This will, however, cause a nonexploitable crash or error message if a user opens a PDF file that contains SWF content. The .dll file is typically located at C:\Program Files\Adobe\Reader 9.0\Reader\authplay.dll for Adobe Reader or C:\Program Files\Adobe\Acrobat 9.0\Acrobat\authplay.dll for Acrobat, Adobe sai

FOR THOSE WHO CANT CHANGE THEIR HOSTS FILE PROPERLY:

first, you have to be logged in as Administrator. to do this (at least in Windows 7):

START>>All Programs>>Accessories>> COMMAND PROMPT (right click and run as administrator). Type this: "net user administrator /active:yes" 

Log off and then log in as Administrator. Now got to Computer >> C:\Windows\System32\drivers\etc and in the map called "etc" there's a file called "hosts". Right click on it and "open with...". Choose NOTEPAD. And then just copy what's in THETHINGY'S instructions into the hosts file! DONE :)

ps. remember to open the command prompt afterwards and type net user administrator /active:no
by the way. thanks to you, THETHINGY for your wonderful uploads!!! keep seeding everybody!
